page.title: 13THE BRICKWORKS, THURSO
page.content: {Thurso Brickworks}near the estuary of{Thurso River}replaced the old Caithness flagstone industry when concrete became a more suitable building material. When the flagstone industry was at its height the boats used to load up at this part of the river. The brickworks are operated by Omand Contractors, a local company. They also run a garage, haulage business and auction rooms nearby. The previous owner of the Brickworks was John Fyfe Ltd. Five men, including a foreman, are employed making bricks and concrete blocks. The raw material comes from Melvich Quarry about 30 miles away. About 4500 bricks are made each day and they are sold mainly to local building firms.
